definition: to pose as sb/to act a part/imposture
to fill/to satisfy/to fulfill/to act in place of/substitute/sufficient/full

sentences.english: He posed as a newsman to get in.
He doesn't pretend to be a genius.
sentences.chinese: 他不想假充自己有什麼才華。

sentences.english: Wood is often painted to imitate stone.
sentences.chinese: 木頭常被塗上油漆假充石頭。

sentences.english: The wood was painted to imitate stone.
sentences.chinese: 木頭常塗油漆假充石頭。

sentences.english: A book is a sess when people who haven't read it pretend they have.
sentences.chinese: 一本書如果沒有看過的人也假充看過，便是樂成的。
第三，造假從而以假充真。

sentences.english: His religion was a mere pretence.

definition: to pass off fish eyes for pearls/to pass off fake products as genuine (idiom)
lit. to steal a rafter and replace it with a column/to replace the original with a fake/to perpetrate a fraud (idiom)
to fool the world and usurp a good name (idiom)
to make up the number (i.e. to fill places up to a given number)/to serve as stopgap
lit. to wave a banner as if it were a tiger skin (idiom)/fig. to borrow sb's prestige/to take the name of a great cause as a shield
pinyin: la1 da4 qi2 zuo4 hu3 pi2

definition: indiscriminately included in company (without any qualification)/see 濫竽充數|滥竽充数[lan4 yu2 chong1 shu4]
lit. to play the yu 竽 mouth organ to make up numbers (idiom); fig. to make up the numbers with inferior products/to masquerade as having an ability/token member of a group
